wikipedia_page.main:
Paul Simmonite (born 17 March 1971) was an English cricketer. He was a right-handed batsman and right-arm medium-pace bowler who played for Cheshire. He was born in Burnley, Lancashire.
Simmonite began his career in the Lancashire League, in which he played for Colne between 1985 and 1990. He played for Derbyshire Second XI between 1990 and 1992.
Simmonite played for Cheshire in the Minor Counties Championship during the 1994 season, making a single List A appearance for the team, against Durham. From the opening order, he scored two runs.
